Package aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars

Class ProbCNFGrammar

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars.ProbUnrestrictedGrammar
      • aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars.ProbContextSensitiveGrammar
        • aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars.ProbContextFreeGrammar
          • aima.core.nlp.parsing.grammars.ProbCNFGrammar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbabilisticGrammar
    public class ProbCNFGrammar
extends ProbContextFreeGrammar
    The CYK algorithm exploits the structure of grammars in Chomsky Normal Form in order to parse efficiently. A context-free grammar is in Chomsky Normal Form (CNF) if each rule has one of the following forms: 1. A -> BC, 2. A -> a, 3. S -> null, where B,C are non-start variables (V - {S}), and a is a terminal.
    Author:
    Jonathon

      • validRule

        public boolean validRule​(Rule r)
        For a grammar rule to be valid in a context-free grammar, all the restrictions of the context-free grammar must hold, and the rule must be in one of three forms. 1. A -> BC, 2. A -> a, 3. S -> null, where B,C are non-start variables (V - {S}), and a is a terminal.
        Specified by:
        validRule in interface ProbabilisticGrammar
        Overrides:
        validRule in class ProbContextFreeGrammar
        Parameters:
        r - , a rule
        Returns:
        true, if rule is in CNF. false, otherwise
